gurmukhi: ਸੋਰ ਕੋਰ ਕ੍ਰੋਰ ਕੈ ਜਹਾਂ ਰਾਮ ਥੇ ਤਹਾਂ ਜਾਤ ਭੇ ||
transliteration: Sor Kor Kror Kai Jahaan Raam The Tahaan Jaat Bhe||
translation: Both them shouting terribly reached near Ram.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਸ ਕੈ ਹਨਵੰਤ ਥਾ ਪਗ ਰੋਪ ਪਾਵ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੀਯੰ ||
transliteration: Ros Kai Hanvant Thaa Pag Rop Paav Prahdareeyan||
translation: Hanuman in great rage firmly stood on the earth on one foot,

gurmukhi: ਜੂਝਿ ਭੂਮਿ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਬਲੀ ਸੁਰ ਲੋਕ ਮਾਂਝਿ ਬਿਹਾਰੀਯੰ ||੩੬੯||
transliteration: Joojh(i) Bhoom(i) Giryo Balisur Lok Maanjh(i) Bihdareeyan||369||
translation: And attacked violently with his second foot with which the mighty Dhumraksha fell down and died.369.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਂਬਮਾਲ ਭਿਰੇ ਕਛੂ ਪੁਨ ਮਾਰਿ ਅੈਸੇ ੲੀ ਕੈ ਲੲੇ ||
transliteration: Jaanbmaal Bhire Kachhodh Poun Daar(i) Aise Ee Kai Lae||
translation: Then Jambumali fought in the war but he was also killed in the same manner;

gurmukhi: ਭਾਜ ਕੀਨ ਪ੍ਵੇਸ ਲੰਕ ਸੰਦੇਸ ਰਾਵਨ ਸੋ ਦੲੇ ||
transliteration: Bhaaj Keen Praves Lank Sandes Raavan So Dae||
translation: The demons accompanying him sped towards Lanka to give the news to Ravana,

gurmukhi: ਧੂਮਰਾਛ ਸੁ ਜਾਂਬਮਾਲ ਦੁਹਹੂੰ ਰਾਘਵਜੂ ਹਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Dhoomraachh Su Jaanbmaal Duh-hoon Raaghav-joo Hario||
translation: That both Dhumraksha and Jambumali had been killed at the hands of Rama.

gurmukhi: ਹੈ ਕਛੂ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਕੇ ਹੀੲੇ ਸੁਭ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਅਾਵਤ ਸੋ ਕਰੋ ||੩੭੦||
transliteration: Hai Kachhodh Prabh(u) Ke Heee Soubh Mantra Aavat Sodaro||370||
translation: They requested him, “O Lord ! now whatever please you, take any other measure.”370.

gurmukhi: ਪੇਖ ਤੀਰ ਅਕੰਪਨੈ ਦਲ ਸੰਗਿ ਦੈ ਸੁ ਪਠੈ ਦਯੋ ||
transliteration: Pekh Teer Akanpadai Dal San(i) Dais U Padhhai Dayo||
translation: Seeing Akampan near him, Ravana sent him alongwith the forces.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤਿ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਬਜੇ ਬਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਨਿਨੱਦ ਸੱਦ ਪੁਰੀ ਭਯੋ ||
transliteration: Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Bade Bajantra Ninadd Sadd Puribhayo||
translation: On his departure, many kinds of musical instruments were played, which resounded in the whole city of Lanka.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰ ਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਪ੍ਹਸਤ ਤੇ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਚਾਰਿਯੋ ||
transliteration: Sur Raae Aadh Prahast Te Eh Bhaant(i) Mantra Bichaariyo||
translation: The ministers including Prahasta held consultation;

gurmukhi: ਸੀਅ ਦੇ ਮਿਲੋ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਕੋ ਕਸ ਰੋਸ ਰਾਵ ਸੰਭਾਰਿਯੋ ||੩੭੧||
transliteration: Seea De Milo Raghuraaj Ko Kas Ros Raav Sanbhaariyo||371||
translation: And thought that Ravana should return Sita to Ram and not offend him more.371.

gurmukhi: ਝਲ ਹਲੰਤ ਤਰਵਾਰ ਬਜਤ ਬਾਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਮਹਾ ਧੁਨ ||
transliteration: Jhal Halant Tarvaar Bajat Baajantra Mahaa Dhoun||
translation: The sound of musical instruments and the striking sound of the swords resounded,

gurmukhi: ਖੜ ਹੜੰਤ ਖਹ ਖੋਲ ਧਯਾਨ ਤਜਿ ਪਰਤ ਚਵਧ ਮੁਨ ||
transliteration: Khad Hadant Khah Dhyaan Taj(i) Parat Chavadh Mounnd|
translation: And the meditation of the ascetics was distracted by the horrible voices of the battlefield.
